# 03 test Garmin data request last three months in Python

# Python 3 API wrapper for Garmin Connect
#  az login within the environment Powershell to log into Azure so Key Vault can authenticate the request using Entra ID
# Install the package using pip: pip3 install garminconnect azure-identity azure-keyvault-secrets azure-keyvault
# Comment out the KeyVaultRequest line if hard-coding your Garmin credentials

import garminconnect
from 02_test_key_vault_connection_Python import get_api_key_from_keyvault
from datetime import datetime, timedelta


def main():
    try:
        # Get API password from Key Vault. Replace with hard-coded values to avoid the KeyVault request
        # Garmin_Username = "My Garmin email/login"
        Garmin_Username = get_api_key_from_keyvault("judeskv", "GarminUsername")
        # Garmin_Username = "My Garmin password"
        Garmin_Password = get_api_key_from_keyvault("judeskv", "GarminPassword")

        if not Garmin_Username:
            print("Garmin_Username retrieval/initialisation failed. Check your Key Vault configuration/python.")
            return
        
        if not Garmin_Password:
            print("Garmin_Password retrieval/initialisation failed. Check your Key Vault configuration/python.")
            return

        # Initialize Garmin Connect client
        client = garminconnect.Garmin(Garmin_Username, Garmin_Password)
        client.login()

        # Calculate start and end dates for the last three months
        today = datetime.today()
        three_months_ago = today - timedelta(days=90)

        # Example: Get activity data for the last three months
        activities_data = client.get_activities_by_date(three_months_ago.strftime("%Y-%m-%d"), today.strftime("%Y-%m-%d"))
        print(f"Activities data for the last three months: {activities_data}")

        # # Example: Get body composition data for the last three months
        # body_composition_data = client.get_body_composition_data(three_months_ago.strftime("%Y-%m-%d"), today.strftime("%Y-%m-%d"))
        # print(f"Body composition data for the last three months: {body_composition_data}")

        # Add more API calls as needed for other statistics and activities

    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error: {e}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
